Name: Lootin' Wizards: Quick Change
Description:
After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. Not all of them were kind and happy wizards, but the old royal mage made sure to leave some nasty tricks behind just for them. Traps and curses of all kinds were left strewn about his hiding places, now being plundered by the wizards seeking to replace him. Will they survive to claim the prize?

Lootin' Wizards: Quick Change is the second, and much anticipated, expansion for the group card/board game where you race around trying to get more loot than your opponents. Now, you can you make spells to actually alter the reality of the world your wizard is racing through. This crazy expansion introduces new Markers to place on the board (changing the very face of the map), the ability to play with up to two more players in a game (up to 8 when used with the basic game), and a great mix of new Spell and Loot cards to add to the mix.

Name: Spilaðu með okkur
Description: A publicity product by the marketing / advertising agency Argus. Players roll a die and move their pawn along the track. If they land on pictures they draw the corresponding card and follow the instructions. The first one to the finish space wins.

Name: Hink Pink
Description:
For two minutes at a time, based on the clues given on each card, a team tries to find an appropriate rhyming pair of words with the proper number of syllables each (1, 2, or 3).

After the two minutes are up, the team receives points based on the number of syllables (1, 2, or 3) for each card. First team to 50 points wins!

Sample cards: 
I have a Hink Pink for...
a French pancake for a gorilla or chimp
"Ape Crepe"

I have a Hinky Pinky for...
a fine rain or mist that sounds like fat frying in a pan
"Drizzle Sizzle"

I have a Hinkity Pinkity for...
a large, Australian jumping marsupial that is late
"Overdue Kangaroo"

Name: My First Number Pairs
Description:
My First Number Pairs is a matching game for preschoolers designed to help teach numbers. Pictures of numbers are matched with pictures of items in various multiples. For example, an 8 card would be matched to a card with a picture of eight butterflies.

Winner is the player who has collected the most pairs.

Name: Pacific 1942 Cadet
Description:
Pacific 1942 Cadet is a simplified version for beginners alias Cadets to play Pacific 1942 Admiral Game. 
In Pacific 1942 Cadet you will acquire the basic skills that will both enable you to enjoy the game and prepare you for the crucible of the full version of the game. 
Every Cadet aspiring to become an Admiral must be an expert in the movement of ships, aircraft and the marines; he or she must distinguish various types of weapons and be able to find the best solution to every situation.
Later on, you can move to Admiral full version. There is nothing in the rules for Cadets that would not apply to the full version, too. Only, as in life, also in Pacific 1942it is true that grey is the theory and green is the tree of life. So how does the full version differ? 
The basic difference is represented by several slight modifications meant to make it more difficult to keep track of the opponent’s strength and intentions.

Name: Balatoni nyomozó
Description:
In this game players are detectives. The chareacters are based on a series of Hungarian films. They travel around the Lake Balaton to acquire every small piece of information. They can make it difficult for the other players by giving them false information. At the end of the game each player writes down his/her ideas about the solution of the mysterious crime; the closest one wins.

There are 30 scenarios given for this game.

Name: Kölyök nyomozó
Description:
In this game players are junior detectives. They have to gather information about villains with magical powers.

There are 15 scenarios given for this game.

Name: 1886 Loures
Description:
Game created and produced for the City Municipality of Loures
This board game is for 2 to 6 players, from 8 years old. It begins a few decades before Loures became a municipality. Each player, at each turn, must contribute to the wealth of Loures developing natural resources and preserving the patrimony of the villages around.
The game ends in 1886 (when Loures becomes a municipality). The player who better enlarges the trade with the neighbour zones, better protects the patrimony, better grows rich due to the fruitful lands of Loures wins more points and will become the first Mayor of the City Municipality of Loures

Name: Rommel's Quest For Jesus Tel el Elisa July 10-15, 1942
Description:
The area the Australians had taken on July 10th included the coastal ridge from Point 26 up to Point 33 and extended from the coast, south to the railway line. The surrounding terrain was flat and open, offering little or no cover.  In such a flat expanse, ridges and rises a mere twenty or thirty yards above sea level give commanding vantage points to their occupants. The height advantage is so slight that one can scarcely appreciate it until actually upon the feature. The 26th Brigade began the difficult task of digging in while reinforcements of artillery, anti-tank guns and machine guns were quickly brought in. Rommel now gave his inevitable response; an all out counterattack to retake this vital ground using threadbare units. Over the next five days, holding this salient would prove extremely tough, with some places changing hands several times. At times the shelling on Tel el Eisa itself made it too hot for either side to occupy.

The Game

Each turn is 12 hrs, with 400 yard hexes. Units are company and platoons for AFVs.

After the Australians had nearly ruptured the Italian line on July 10, Rommel diverted many of this available troops to stop the hemorrhage as it threatened his rear area. However, the coastline ridge of hills and the Hill of Jesus (Tel el Eisa) barred their success. Once the Australians had secured their advance and held the hills, Rommel had no choice but to try to seize them back and from the 10th through 15th, this is what he did.

Name: Sticks
Description:
Sticks is in the Rummy family of card games.  It is played with 2- 8 players with 4 decks (including jokers).  Melding of sets and runs is similar to Rummy but each player has their own goal (written on a "stick").  Players have a hand of 15 cards and goals ranges from the use of 5 to 12 cards.

Each round players draw new sticks (goals) only if they completed their stick during the previous round.  Those who did not complete their stick must try again to complete the same stick in the new round.  Winner is the first to 7 sticks.  A scoring variant is sometimes used where the game ends at 7 sticks but each stick is valued by the number of cards necessary to complete the goal.

Name: Squish Blocks
Description:
Squish Blocks is an abstract strategy game where players lay square colored cards to create a board. Players try to create a situation of sandwiching a different colored card between two like color cards. When this occurs, the player captures the block in between and scores the points. Players may capture multiple cards in one turn.

Games can be set up for short or quick games depending on the size of the board created. Games can be as short as a couple of minutes and perfect for multiple quick fun games.

Name: Universal Fighting System: Warhammer – Age of reckoning Promo
Description:
A set of UFS cards containing 2 heroes, one each from Order and Destruction.  With Tchar'zanek for Chaos army, and Karl Franz from the Armies of the Empire.

This promo was to promote the Warhammer Heroes within the Universal Fighting System Universe, for the Warhammer Online MMO.

The Cards were released along with the release of the MMO Warhammer Online - Age Of Reckoning.

Name: Harpoon: Ship Forms – Ship Data Sheets and Scenarios
Description:
An expansion for 3rd Edition Harpoon, it contains over 35 premade forms covering ships from both American and Soviet naval and air forces.

It includes:
USS John F. Kennedy (CV-64)
USS Nimitz (CVN-68)
USS Iowa
USS Ticonderoga
USS South Carolina
USS Virginia
USS Belknap
USS Coontz
USS Radford
USS Isaac C. Kidd
USS Clifton Sprague
USS McCandless

EA-6B Prowler
F-14A Tomcat
A-7E Corsair
A-6E/TRAM Intruder
S-3 Viking
SH-60B Seahawk
SH-3H Sea King
AV-8B Harrier II
F/A-18 Hornet

Kiev
Moskva
Kirov
Varyag
Nikolayev
Sderzhannyy
Vitse-Admiral Drozd
Kronshtadt
Nesokrushimyy
Udaloy
Storozhevoy
Bessmennyy
Sovremennyy

Yak-38 Forger
Su-24 Fencer C
Ka-25 Hormone A
Ka-27 Helix

Name: My First Picture Pairs
Description: My First Picture Pairs is a game for preschoolers designed to help them with the memory in a simple matching game. Face down cards are arranged in a grid and players turn them over to find matches. The pictures on the cards are large, bright, and colorful so that children can easily differentiate between them.

Name: Harpoon: ASW Forms – Antisubmarine Warfare Data Sheets and Scenarios
Description:
An expansion for 3rd Edition Harpoon, it contains pre-made aircraft, submarine, and ship forms of 10 different countries as well as an ASW scenario generator and playing aids for ASW scenarios.

It includes the following forms:

Canada - Iroquois class, CH-124 Sea King
France - Amethyste class, Georges Leygues class, Le Redoubtable class, Tourville class
FRG - Bremen class, Hamburg class, Lynx Mk88
Japan - Chikugo class, Yushio class, Imp. Yushio class, Shirane class
Norway - Oslo class, Type 210 class
PRC - Han class, Luda class
Sweden - Goteborg class, Nacken class, Vastergotland class
UK - Leander/2TA class, Vanguard class
USA - Arleigh Burke class, Lafayette class, Ohio class
USSR - Delta III class, Delta IV class, Grisha III/V class,
Kashin class, Mirka II class, Pauk class, Yankee I class
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Harpoon: Sub Forms – Submarine Data Sheets
Description:
An expansion for the 3rd Edition Harpoon, it contains pre-made submarine forms for 7 different countries, and over 35 submarines.

It includes:

USA - Barbel class, Los Angeles class, Imp. Los Angeles class, Narwhal class, Permit class, Seawolf class, Skipjack class, Sturgeon class

USSR - Akula class, Alfa class, Charlie I class, Charlie II class, Echo II class, Echo II Mod class, Foxtot class, Juliett class, Kilo class, November class, Oscar I class, Sierra class, Tango class, Typhoon class, Victor III class, Yankee SSN class

UK - Oberon class, Swiftsure class, Trafalgar class, Upholder class, Valiant class

French - Agosta class, Daphne class, Rubis class

Italian - Salvatore Pelosi class, Nazario Sauro class, Enrico Toti class

FRG - U-13 class, Type 211 class

Dutch - Zwaardvis class

Name: Funny Phonics
Description: Funny Phonics is a sequel to the children's sentence game, Silly Sentences. This edition adds a 12 sided dice and a spinner indicating what type of word may be used (adjective, noun, verb, etc). Players form sentences with word and picture cards. These are generally intended to be silly, such as "The smug teapot met the yellow cat."

Name: My First: What's My Job?
Description: My First: What's My Job? is a children's educational game designed to help children associate objects with the jobs the people who use them and to help stimulate conversation. Game cards feature pictures of children acting out jobs such as Teacher, Fireman, and Singer as well as the objects they use. Players must match these cards together. For example, the fireman would match with the fire extinguisher, the singer would match with the microphone, and the teacher would match with the chalkboard. The player with the most matches is the winner.

Name: Farm Counting Fun
Description:
Farm Counting Fun is a children's educational game that teaches simple math skills like addition, subtraction, and number recognition. Players have a bingo style board and draw cards with images of animals and farm foods on them. Cards are placed on the board according to how the numbers add up. The first player to fill their board is the winner.

Includes 4 farm boards, 48 farm pieces, 24 action cards, easy-to-follow instructions. For 2-4 players ages 3-6. Developed in association with a leading educational consultant.

Name: Very Silly Sentences
Description:
Very Silly Sentences is a sequel to Silly Sentences.

From the publisher:
Learning basic language and literacy skills to give children a head start as they start school is as easy as A, B, C with this fun game.

Colour-coded cards will help your child learn parts of speech and sentence construction with hilarious consequences. The banana jumped over the tree, the cow ate the alarm clock. No sentence is too silly in this addictive game for the whole family.

Name: Silly Rhymes
Description: Silly Rhymes is a sentence making game similar to Silly Sentences. In this game though, the words in the sentence have to rhyme. Players place word cards in a row to form funny rhyming sentences such as, "The fat cat pats a hat" and "The smug bug hugs the rug." The winner is the first player to discard all their words.

Name: Sitzkrieg
Description:
Sitzkrieg is an expansion set for Axis and Allies which includes a new board sized 80 x 150 cm, an Excel based IPC-tracker, printable battleboards and a PDF based printable rules set.

The set comes without plastic figurines, so you need at least any of the Axis and Allies games with all major powers present or spare parts from Xeno Games to have enough figurines for all nations. The playable nations are: Germany, Italy, Japan, USSR, Chinese Communist Party (CCP) Kuomintang (KMT), France (Free & Vichy), Netherlands, neutrals and Britisch Commonwealth Nations divided into UK, Canada, South Africa, India and Australia.

The map offers you geographical features such as rivers and mountains that have their own influence on the units. When set up, the game starts with a couple of events that took place before 1939. You have to roll for the Second Sino-Japanese war and for the Spanish Civil War to start with. The Long March, The purge and the Winter War all take place in what is called turn zero.Starting turn 1 you may roll for nation specific technologies. Urban Warfare, Burma Road, Lend Lease, Convoys, International and Territorial Waters, Ports, Elite Infantry, Partisans, Spanish Blue Division, Political Leaders are elements that enhance the realistic feel of the game.

The goal is to win a bronze, silver or gold (historical) victory over your enemies.

Rules for which Axis and Allies and Xeno pieces can not be used:
-Weather effects like rain, heat, snow, fog and wind effect your troop's mobility. You can make your own weather markers or use the Litko Aerosystems weather markers.
-Oil Derricks (we recommend Petropolis pieces) and oil drums (we recommend the supply counters from Axis and Allies Battle of the Bulge)
-Commanders (we recommend 1/72 scale minis, Table Tactics jeeps or Axis and Allies miniatures commanders) Commanders allow surrender or retreat options.
-Elite Infantry (we recommend 1/72 scale minis or AA Miniatures

To get all the miniatures to play all the rules is a bit of work, but remember you can also use them to make house rules for your regular Axis and Allies games or use the Sitzkrieg rules as an expansion to your own games.

Name: My First Board Game
Description:
My First Board Game is a simple game for even the youngest players. Children turn over a tile and more to the color-coded space. Everyone wins! Colorful illustrations feature characters from Suzy's Zoo.

Desigen as an Early Learning System, the bookshelf series becomes progressively challenging as a child matures from ages 2 to 4 and up. The games are sized for small hands and easily fit on a bookshelf. They are safe for Toddlers to Tots... there are no small parts.

The delighful characters of Little Suzy's Zoo bring the game to life!

Name: Grand Prix Jumping
Description:
In Grand Prix Jumping the players take on the roles of riders leading their steeds through a Grand Prix competition course which includes fences of varying rail heights, as well as a water jump. Getting through the course fast will help your cause but will not guarantee victory as the winner is not the horse that finishes fastest but the one with fewest fault points.

You design the course before each game so the strategy will change with each play. You can make the course as demanding as you want. While Grand Prix Jumping is at its heart a card game, there is very little luck involved and the better skilled rider will be victorious.

Name: Tutela
Description: Players control groups of postilions, who have to arrive to their goals as soon as possible. Each hex on the board has a number on every side; a roll of a die decides which direction a postilion can leave. The first player wins who arrives with all his/her postilions to their goals.

Name: Instant Spandaus
Description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for WWI planes similar to the game Instant Thunder and Instant Bandits. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns.

Planes have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each plane to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Planes may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting is performed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the planes are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and very complete aircraft statistics.

Name: Österreichisches Sammelsurium
Description:
To do well at Österreichisches Sammelsurium, you'll not only have to hold your own when guessing the answers to various outlandish and often humorous questions about Austria, but also be able to convincingly make up facts on the fly.

Questions are divided into three catgories: Knowledge, Creative and Estimates.

Name: Klingon Armada
Description:
Klingon Armada is an official conversion of the Setting: Star Fleet Universe to the Starmada rules. Players can fight one-on-one duels, but Klingon Armada is particularly suited for fleet engagements. The rules are simple, but not simplistic.

Each turn, players simultaneously write orders for all of their ships, and then the orders are executed in turn order. The mechanics for combat are simple, but there is large amount of variety in the weapon effects. Ships lose effectiveness from damage until they are expanding clouds of debris.

Klingon Armada can be played with miniatures or counters from the Game: Federation Commander series.

This book includes quick-start rules and 40 starship diagrams (from Klingon Border and Klingon Attack).

Additional books with more starships are planned.

Integrates with:

    Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
    Romulan Armada

Name: The College Football Chronology
Description:
Actionsims is proud to introduce its latest offering, The College Football Chronology (CFC). CFC features every college team in the history of the USA (along with many foreign colleges) rated in offensive & defensive ability.  Teams are also given an overall performance rating. Replay entire historical seasons quickly & accurately, or set up your own fantasy schedules.

Play games with DI, DII, DIII *Universities 

    Junior/Community Colleges 
    NAIA teams 
    Indian Schools
    Military Academies
    Business Schools, Medical, Dental & Law Schools 
    Military Base clubs, NTSs, Air *Bases, Infantry & Battleship squads
    Parochial Schools & Schools for Mutes & the Deaf
    Town Teams, Athletic Clubs, YMCA Teans
    Varsity/Alumni/Sophomores/Freshmen squads
    Many high school teams from the late 1800s - early 1900s are also included. 


Game engine utilizes fast action cards; playing time is about about 30 minutes.  Many different drive charts provide for a variety of outcomes. Score sheets for 4 different eras, box score and extra charts: track stats as you play. Charts for 1 & 2-point PATS, hurry up offense, onside kicks, and more.  Play matches between different divisions &/or classes, using the included inter-division rating system.  Detailed timing system coupled with team strength ratings produces realistic scoring output.  Rule changes for differing eras are incorporated, including timing of halves/quarters, point values for scores, PAT rules and overtimes.

Name: Avus Autorennen
Description: Avus car race including the vib-dice-automatic is a simple car racing game where every player choose one of four cars and roll (using the vib-dice-automatic) and move along the racetrack. The board includes the names of several brands such as: ARAL, Continental, Bosch and Coca Cola suggesting that the game might have been sponsored by these  companies.

Name: Conquest of Paradise Expansion: Random Events Cards
Description:
This expansion (with rules) came inside C3i Magazine Nr22 published by RBM Studio.

There are 27 event cards. Once a player hits 5VP, one event card is drawn each turn by the current player with the lowest VP count. Ties are resolved using the usual island order.

Name: Progress
Description:
Progress is an LDS trivia game designed to help stimulate an interest in studying Mormon Doctrine. Players answer trivia questions in order from easiest to hardest. Each successive card is worth more than the preceding card. Players earn the highest points answered correctly. For example, if a player correctly answers a 2 point question and a 5 point question but misses the 10 point question, he or she would earn 5 points. The first player to earn 200 points is the winner.

Question categories are:
Book of Mormon
Old Testament
New Testament
Church History
Church Doctrine

Name: Heart to Heart
Description:
Heart to Heart is a card game designed to help stimulate conversation between friends and family members. Each card has a a question printed on it which players have to answer. Some are very general and others are more personal such as "What attracts you to the opposite sex?" and "What was your most romantic moment? Did you initiate it, or did you receive it?" There are Mystery Cards which players can use to keep their answer a secret (to avoid revealing things they don't wish to).

A variation of the game requires you to answer the questions for the other player with the person who answers the most correctly being the winner.

Name: Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion
Description:
E4 (Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion) is the first official expansion for Experiment.

This expansion gives the players new options to choose and new strategies to play the game.

E4 introduces a new card type: the special lab card.

Special lab cards are mysterious, no player may look at them before taking them. You never know what you are going to get ... it might be a double colour joker but it can also be a normal one colour flask or even an empty Erlenmeyer. 
The card remains hidden for your opponents so they won't know what you have until you use it.
An empty Erlenmeyer can even give you in certain situations the edge of winning a close game with half a point.

E4 also adds 6 new secret lab cards for even more fun.

Name: Jetzt geht's los, Kleiner Rabe
Description:
There are 32 cards devided in 8 groups of 4 cards. With these cards the players can play 5 different games.

Alle Viere: Every player gets four cards in theis hands. The other cards are placed in the middle of the table. The game is played like 'Go Fish.'

Gleich und Gleich: Starting with the youngest. The cards are placed face down on the table. each player tries to find the same kind of cards. Played like Memory.

Eins, Zwei, Drei: The deck is shuffled and every player gets 6 cards. The other cards are placed on the table. In a players turn he/she gets a card and discards a card. The object of the game is to collect 3 or 4 cards of the same kind.

Aufgepaßt: This game is all about 'reaction'. every player gets a deck of cards. Simutaneously the players turn their first card face up. The players who have the same picture, tries to place their hand on the other player card. The first player who gets the card wins both cards.

Angeschmiert: All the cards but one are shuffled and devided among the players. At the players turn, he/she takes a card from an another player. When the player collects a pair, its placed open on the table.

Name: Activity Turbo
Description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition you have only 60 seconds to describe the 4 expressions on the card.

Name: Activity Turbo Junior
Description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where players have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition the words are familiar to children and they have to describe as much of the 4 words as they can in 60 seconds.

Name: 20 Jahre Activity
Description: The twentieth anniversary edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition comes with 2500 new ideas.

Name: Honfoglaló Családi Társasjáték
Description: The family edition of the game Honfoglaló. Players can conquer areas (counties of Hungary) by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer the whole country. This edition contains 1200 questions for children and 1200 questions for grown-ups.

Name: Érettségiző honfoglaló társasjáték
Description:
Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players can conquer areas (counties of Hungary) by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer the whole country.

In this special edition there are 2160 new questions, which help to prepare to the final exam at the end of the high school in Hungary.

Name: Í skóinn
Description: A single track game that is included with the album Í skóinn by the designer. Players roll and move their pawns (not included) and follow the instructions if needed. The first one to the finish space wins the game.

Name: Rummino
Description: Rummino is a variation of a rummy game that although has a simple concept of matching requires strategy and forethought. The game comes with 92 tiles with 5 suits (clubs, hearts, diamonds, spades and stars)and 5 ranks (9, 10, jack, Queen, King, Ace). Each player starts with 7 tiles which are used to score the most points by creating sets and runs. If players are able to finish off a run or set, that player receives double or triple the points for that round. Rummino is a unique rummy game that is easy to learn yet strategically challenging to even the most advanced gamers.

Name: Katudi 2
Description:
This children's matching game, published by Djeco, has 3 sets of large player mat type cards with busy, whimsical illustrations which are divided by a grid, and a set of smaller, matching, image tiles for each illustration.  One player draws a tile and describes the image on it while the others search for the matching grid space on their player mats.  The first to correctly identify the matching space wins the tile, and the player with the most matching tiles at the end of the game wins.

This is a great game for children who are developing oral language skills or vocabulary, and would be fun with any age to practice a foreign language.

The game rules come in 8 languages and the game itself is language independent.

The game suggests an age of 6 and up, but I think that this game could easily be used with much younger children.

Name: Blue the Grey & the Butternut
Description:
Excerpt from the book:

"The main and only aim of these rules is to allow a few people to get together and quickly set up a table, play a large game in an evening or an all day game on the weekend, have fun, have realistic results and achieve those results and also know who has won."

User summary:

This is a set of miniatures rules for corps-army level actions, where each player takes on the role of corps commander.

Scale:
Ground scale:  1" = 100 yds.
Time scale:  10 min/turn
Stands: base represents a demi-brigade (approximately 500-1000 men), base sizes are 3-4" wide by 1.5-2" deep.
Figure scale:  there is no required figure scale or number of figure/base requirement

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: Die wichtigsten Verkehrsschilder
Description: Help Benjamin Blümchen and his friends to learn the traffic rules. A children's game where they learn the most important traffic rules. It's played like Go Fish.

Name: Nyelvtanulók társasjátéka
Description:
Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players, divided into three teams can conquer areas  by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer everything.

The aim of this special edition is to help learn the English or German language. The areas are parts of Germany or England, and the questions are about the German and English language on three different levels: beginner, intermediate or upper-intermediate.

Name: Klatschmücke
Description: Each player has a fly swatter. Six mosquitoes are put on the game board, then a disk is spun and eventually reveals the color of the insect that is to be swatted. The mosquito will be caught in the fastest player's swatter. After all the bugs are gone, each caught one yields a point and a new round is started.

Name: The Chaps from Amsterdam
Description:
The Chaps from Amsterdam has been formulated through years of hard work, in bedrooms, front rooms, pubs, clubs, raves, festivals, police cells and prison cells. Over the past decade we have taken an idea and given it life, transforming it into the product that we are proud to show to you today. Hard Impact Board Games is a street orientated company that has created a game that is not only realistic but also enjoyable to play.

The game can be played by a maximum of 6 players, with 6 characters to choose from, Billy, Bob, Sid, Charlie, Eedid and Grief. Their aim after leaving Amsterdam is to take to the streets and off load their SPACE...Making as much money as possible.

Keep your wits about you! Trust nobody and never be to flash with your cash as like in real life the police, courts and informers are waiting for you around each and every corner!

This is a game and is not a promotion for illegal activities, all information contained within the game is for educational, recreational and historical purposes ,it is not our intention to incite the use of controlled or illegal substances.

Name: Shuluri viadal
Description: This game is based on the Hungarian rpg M.A.G.U.S. Players control teams of fighters in an arena. Different characters, weapons, sorceries, amulets, traps give the game great diversity.

Name: Olympia Gold
Description: "Olympia Gold" is a world class Equestrian Board Game that depicts real life thrills and excitement of Dressage, Cross Country, and Stadium Jumping competition throughout the world.  The winner is determined by the person or team to accumulate the most points, controlling the unified player and getting to the gold first. Play Olympia Gold in sequences, Dressage first, continuing on to Cross Country, and finally Stadium, totaling your score for all three just like in real life, or play Olympia Gold simultaneously, all three disciplines at the same time, as individuals or teams.

Name: Three to Match
Description:
Three to Match is an educational children's game. Each player is given a board with several picture combinations on it in sets of three. There are ten squares on the board, each of which contains three images, a tree, a bird, and a tea kettle. A block may contain any combination of the images, for example, two birds and a tree. Players also have a stack of cards with the images on them.

Players roll dice containing the images and then chose a card that has the images rolled and place it on the corresponding place on their board (the image on the board and the card should be the same). The winner is the first player to fill all ten spots on their board.

Name: Mokadi
Description:
Mokadi is a game of building and dismantling a tangle of sticks in equilibrium. The sticks may move but should never fall down.
A game of dexterity and balance.

Name: Abriss
Description:
At the beginning the play area consists of various buildings (on tiles). The objective of the game is to destroy these buildings. You need workers for that occasional specialists.
Its a bit like a common "building game" where you need resources to erect buildings, except that you are now trying to dismantle the buildings for victory points.

Scheduled for Essen 2009

Name: Vinspelet
Description: You travel around Europe, and answer questions and drink wine to earn bottles. The first person to get twelve bottles wins. It is a light party game, where people might get a little tipsy.

Name: Tatü-Tata Das Krankenwagenspiel
Description:
Raise the alarm! The ambulance is on call! The paramedics need luck and good memory skills to find their way to the right house. Oh dear! Cars are blocking the streets on the way back to the hospital. How you have to use the warning light and deliver the patient to the hospital.

Tatü-Tata Das Krankenwagenspiel follows the "sensory" ideas from Haba's Tatü-Tata game, but this is a stand-alone game and not an expansion to that one.

The game is packaged in a tin ambulance with rolling wheels that holds all the game pieces but also can be used as a toy on its own.

Name: Tatü-Tata Das Feuerwehrspiel
Description:
Raise the alarm! The fire brigade has been called out. The fire engine takes them to their next place of action. Who will put out the fire or rescue the kitten in the tree? If you have some skill, a good memory, and a bit of luck you can collect many badges.

Tatü-Tata Das Feuerwehrspiel follows the "sensory" ideas from Haba's Tatü-Tata game, but this is a stand alone game and not an expansion to that one.

The game is packaged in a tin fire truck with rolling wheels that holds all the game pieces but also can be used as a toy on its own.

Name: Tatü-Tata: Das Polizeispiel
Description:
Sound the alarm, the police are after the crooks! In which building are they hiding? Through which exit will the notorious gang try to flee? Only a clever policeman who keeps good track of the situation will cath the most tricks.

Tatü-Tata Das Polizeispiel uses the same "sensory" ideas as Haba's Tatü-Tata game, but this is a standalone game and not an expansion to that one.

The game comes packaged in a tin police van with rolling wheels that holds all of the game pieces but also can be used as a toy on its own.

Name: Klex-Klax: Das farbige Würfelspiel
Description: Each player has four meeples; they begin the game on the outer edge of the game board. Before them there is a train moving around the board. A color die determines a color on which a meeple or the train may be moved. If a train stops in front of a meeple, the meeple can board; later it can exit on the inside of the track. From there, the meeples have to move to a school. The game ends when six meeples are in the schools; the player with most meeples inside wins.

Name: Erasta Eestimaist
Description: This old Estonian game is a cross breed from several games like Payday, Go For Broke and Monopoly. In this game you will play for the year you have to live. Money is used to buy more or you can take years from your mom for example:D. By buying yourself properties you get years to your life and vice versa. It is basically just real estate game with some weird twists. Game is played by 2 dice and up to six players.

Name: Lift
Description: This game is played on a 6x6 grid. One player puts 36 balls into the grid (3x12 of the same color). The pattern must be symmetric. Afterwards he/she covers the balls with 36 "lids". The other players now take turns lifting individual lids and checking the color. When a player thinks he or she knows the entire pattern, he or she makes a sketch on a piece of paper. After a number of rounds, the player with least errors wins.

Name: Macht die Bäume wieder grün
Description: Players try to plant a forest from 36 tree cards (18 different trees). In order to plant a tree, the player must have a matching "planting card". Also, the other players can hand out obstruction cards which have to be covered with matching solution cards. The cards come with some information about the depletion of forests, a major topic in Germany in the 1980.

Name: Mahlzeit
Description: Simple roll and move game in which dogs try to get to bowls of dog food and bring them home. Afterwards they can turn them around. If the color of the bowl matches that of the dog that dog has won. If not, the dog has to start over.

Name: Onkel Doktor
Description: The players are doctors examining a patient. One illness is randomly chosen and hidden in a pouch. The players move "medical" items (stethoscope, thermometer etc.) around a board by rolling dice. When an item reaches a field with a matching symbol, the player can check a symptom from the pouch. In the course of the game, players gather more and more information until someone makes a correct guess about the disease.

Name: Total verrücktes Pferderennen
Description: Simple dice rolling game for the very young. Wooden horse figures are placed on the starting field of a circular track. Players then take turn rolling a color die. The horse of the color shown moves forward by one field. The first horse reaching the finish line (16 fields onwards) is the winner.

Name: Rauf & Runter
Description: This is essentially Snakes and Ladders, but the snakes (in this case: slides) and ladders are not printed on the game board but separate pieces which the players may place before their turn to influence the outcome of the game.

Name: So ein Affentheater
Description: Players roll and move their monkeys through the jungle. On some squares they can use a catapult and try to fling a monkey into a tree. The first player to get all three monkeys into the tree is the winner.

Name: Split 1000
Description: The game consists of number cards (1-10, 12, 15, 20, 25) and color cards. In a move, a player places two cards on an open stack. If he or she can place a number card higher than the previous one plus a color card of the same color on one stack, he or she gets to keep it (until it is taken away by another player).

Name: A Game of Inches
Description: The object it to get the cards to add up to 2 inches or come as close as possible without going over 2 inches.

Name: På poängjakt i Bibeln: Gamla Testamentet
Description: A swedish quiz game about the bible (the old testament). The players score points by collecting cards in different "families" and by answering questions about the bible.

Name: Sofort
Description: There are 13 letter dice and three number dice. All dice are rolled at once. The numbers on the dice determine the goal of the round: The letter dice have values, and the players have to find a word made of the available letters with the overall value determined by the dice.

Name: 3 Dimensional Chess
Description: 3-D Chess is played on a 4x4x4 grid. The published board is a two dimensional representation of a three dimensional board. Special rules govern the movement of the pieces in the third dimension. White begins on the upper most level, while Black begins at the bottom. The object is the same as traditional chess - checkmate the opposing king.

Name: Sport Quiz
Description: Simple roll and move game with one twist: on some place of the board the players have to answer trivia questions about the Olympics or world championships. 500 questions in Hungarian are included.

Name: Őseink nyomában
Description:
In this game players start with a secret mission to conquer certain areas (counties of the medieval Hungary). When a territory is attacked, a type of question is randomly chosen. A third player describes a phrase verbal, pantomimic or by drawing, or asks a trivia question about history, art or science. The first of the two opponents to answer wins the battle. The first player who conquers all the areas on his/her mission card wins the game.

Expansion: Åseink nyomÃ¡ban pÃ³tkÃ©rdÃ©sek 10 Ã©ves kortÃ³l

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Zombie Apocalypse
Description:
The age of industrialization has come to the United States. Iron roads cover the once virgin landscape and investors pocket generous returns. However, something is stirring in the graveyards of Pennsylvania and Michigan. The recently dead are rising from the grave and attacking cities in increasing numbers, which makes the end of year returns increasingly paltry and the competition stiffer. The future of the human race seems to be in question, but a more immediate concern is occupying train company owners: how to maintain profitability in the midst of a Zombie Apocalypse?

This expansion for Age of Steam features 2 maps, each designed to accommodate a different scale. the Western Pennsylvania map supports 4-5 players, while the Michigan map is tailored especially for 3. The expansions additionally come packaged with a dedicated action/income/shares track, and 30 plastic zombies due to the generosity of Twilight Creations, Inc., who have allowed the reuse of their excellent plastic zombie bits. The expansion is intended for experienced Age of Steam players and features very little randomness after the initial board set-up.

Name: Pikk-pakk
Description: This game is played on a 9x9 grid. There are 49 balls, 24 and 24 in the color in the players and one special ball placed in the inner 7x7 grid (it can be random, or the players put their balls step by step, or they choose a starting position together). In a step a player can push all the balls in a row or a column to one direction if he/she controls more than half of those balls. The game end if the special ball has 4 neighbors of the same color (that is the winning color).

Name: Pit Stop
Description:
Race fans start your engines! The game is about to begin.
Kids play it until they drop. Grown-ups peel out for it. Even grandmothers turn into rabid weasels over a game of Pitstop.

What is Pitstop? A fun family card game based on a simple idea: Players race each other to complete a run of numbered "Lap" cards; then be the first to play the checkered flag card to win the game.
But there’s a catch. Pitstop cards lurk in the deck and they can ruin any dreams of a quick win.
A game of Pitstop can be fast and furious because players can play all the cards in their hand in one turn and Lady Luck, in the form of prized wild cards, can make or break a racing career in a hurry.

One of the best things about Pitstop is that it can take as little as 5 minutes for one game or all day for a Pitstop tournament. Race Season rules are included for a 10-race, 20-race or whatever-race competition.

The game consists of 108 unique, racing-themed plastic-coated playing cards, divided into two decks. English and Spanish rules.

Name: B.J.U.opoly
Description:
This is a monopoly style game about Bob Jones University.

"Temporary cuts from the pain of too much studying."

Includes game board, 4 pawns, play money, 2 dice, Credit tokens, Diploma tokens, Collegian cards, Campus Mail cards, deed cards, and instructions.

Name: R.I.D.E.
Description:
"R.I.D.E. stands for Reduce Impaired Drivers Everywhere"

This is an educational game about traffic safety and the dangers of drinking and driving. It features six adjustable dials that the players use to monitor their blood alcohol level.

R.I.D.E. also includes a colorful board, 6 pawns, a die, question cards, rules, and a storage insert.

Name: Squares
Description: Two players move across a simple game board, trying to reach the starting line of the other player and therefore win the game. In each turn, one playing piece (chip) can be moved forward one field. By building majorities on a given line, the other player can be forced to equalize or retreat from his/her position. If that is not possible, the front chip has to be removed.

Name: Störrischer Esel
Description: Simple dice-rolling game for children. 24 donkey tiles are laid out on the table. The players roll a die and move forward, flipping open the tile they land on. The tiles contain numbers: -3,-2,-1,0,+1,+2 or +3, so the player can move forward or backward again. The first player to exactly reach the last tile is the winner.

Name: Such mich: fang mich
Description: Two players try to move 10 points worth of playing pieces (each of the eight pieces counts 1-3 points) into the target area. The points also say how far a piece can move. At the beginning of the game, about 50 wooden bricks are set up on marked fields. They contain holes to put the playing pieces in secretly. At a player's discretion, he or she can take out a hidden piece and start moving. If the other player passes a wooden brick with a hidden piece, that piece has to move out (and might eliminate the triggering piece immediately, if the hidden piece was a 1 point piece).

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Bretagne
Description: The famous trivia game. The questions are about the French region Bretagne. There are 3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geographie, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.

Name: Monopoly: Magdeburg
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The monopoly game. The theme of this version is the German city of Magdeburg.

Name: The Pinocchio Game
Description:
Rescue Gepetto from the whale in The Pinocchio Game by searching the village for a ladder. The first player to reach the whale's belly wins. The Pinocchio Game comes with a unique two-part game board that lets the children create adventures and enter their favorite fairy tale.
Contents: Two-part game board, four playing pieces, a spinner, game cards and complete instructions. Ages 3 to 8, no reading required.
University Games, 1990.

Name: Resorts
Description:
Orlando Edition - "The new World"

In May 1965, major land transactions were recorded a few miles southwest of Orlando in Osceola County. Rumors say that large investors will start to develop this large land area and that large themeparks and other commercial projects are planned. This will open for great opportunities by being part of the large expansion that now will follow. You and other investors establish your business in the area, build hotels, restaurants and create the necessary infrastructure. There are a lot of prioritizing and strategic decisions to be made and it will be an interesting and challenging mission to be number one.

The Resorts board game is played over a decided number years (10, 15 or 20) and can be played with the full rule set or with a more simplified rule set, appropiate for a family game with younger players. Every year a number of actions are allowed for each player decided by the roles chosen. Players buy vacant land from the government, build and expand on owned properties and connect them by building roads. The current economy affect the prices and yearly generated income. Commercial projects will be built every second year which creates benefits for nearby properties. The winner of the game is the player with the most incomepoints (IP) when the last year round is finished.

Name: Takarékoskodj
Description: This is an old Hungarian Monopoly-type game. There are only six properties where you can build a house (3 rooms step by step), but you can build a weekend house on a different kind of property, you can buy a car and saving bonds. The first player to get all of these wins.

Name: Ahoy, Me Hearties
Description:
"Ahoy, Me Hearties!" is advertised as a 'Pirate Counting Game'.

The aim of the game is to race around the island and be the first pirate to collect ten old coins.

Contents are:
- 1 island playing board
- 1 shipwreck and stands
- 2 palm trees and stands
- 4 treasure chest boards
- 4 pirate character counters
- 37 gold coins
- 1 spinner
- 1 colour spot die

The game is part of the Young Learner series by Clementoni.

Name: Capitaly 2000: Sopron
Description: This is a regional version of Capitaly (the Hungarian clone of Monopoly). The properties are from the city Sopron, the currency is, strangely, euro.

Name: Capitaly 2000: Győr
Description: This is a regional version of Capitaly (the Hungarian clone of Monopoly). The properties are from the city GyÅ‘r, the currency is, strangely, euro.

Name: Activity Pótkérdések I.
Description: Hungarian expansion to the well-known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This expansion contains 220 new cards with 1320 phrases.

Name: Activity: Pótkérdések II
Description: Hungarian expansion to the well-known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This expansion contains 220 new cards with 1320 phrases.

Name: Dice Motor Racing Game
Description:
Dice Motor Racing Game is a small dice racing game which comes in a tube.

Content:

2 spot dice
1 special chance die
4 counters
1 race circuit board
1 instruction

The players try to reach the finish at first to win the race. At some situations the player have to roll the chance die which brings some positve or negative effects like moving some spaces forward or backward.

Name: Super-Match
Description: Abstract strategy for two. Each player has six pawns which are placed on the outer rim of the game board. Each move consists of moving one pawn one field in any direction. If a pawn gets stuck between two opposing pawns, it is removed. The first player that is reduced to one pawn is the loser.

Name: Tante Klara packt den Koffer und...
Description: Variation of the (German?) classic game "Kofferpacken". There are 108 item cards. The starting player announces that aunt Klara packs her suitcase and takes item X (puts tile on the table). The next player puts another tile on top, announcing that aunt Klara packs item X and item Y. Continue until somebody cannot repeat the entire list of things stacked up. That player has to take all stacked tiles. The first player to run out of tiles is the winner.

Name: Tauziehen
Description: Each player rolls a die and moves six playing pieces along separate lanes (each player is on one side of the game board). In a dividing strip of the game board, there is a "rope" marker, that each player tries to pull to his/her side. This is achieved by setting up certain positions of one's playing pieces, such as three in a straight line, diagonal or certain color combination. The player who pulls the "rope" closest is the winner.

Name: Teichspiel
Description:
Cooperative game about protecting wildlife in little ponds. Each player has a pond and tries to fill it with different animals (frogs, dragonflies, etc.). There is a special die showing which animal to put into one's pond, but it also has a digger side. If a player rolls this symbol, a piece is added to a digger puzzle. For the neutral clover leaf side, one can put an environmentalist (pawn) in front of the digger. If eight protesters are in front of the digger before it is completed, the first player to fill up his/her pond with eight animals, wins. Otherwise, everybody loses.

Only two of each animal can be in a pond. A player who rolls an animal that is already in his/her pond twice, has to "donate" the roll to another player.

Name: Tier-Lotto
Description: Children's game in which the players walk around a board trying to collect a set of three cards: An animal, its food and its housing. At first, each time a player rolls and moves, the symbol on the square he or she gets to shows which card type to draw (or, in some cases, that he or she has to return a card). Later, when one or more stacks are depleted, a player who rolls the corresponding symbol can get a card from another player.

Name: Vorsicht: aufgepasst!
Description: Each player has three playing pieces and a car in his or her color. The playing pieces (a Sesame Street character) walk on the sidewalk, looking for a chance to cross the road to reach the inner part of the game board. For this, one has to cross a zebra crossing when no car is within three fields. The cars are moved with the same dice results as the playing pieces, but cover a longer distance (two fields per die point). The first player to get all three pieces to the inner area is the winner.

Name: Wie spät ist es?
Description: A game in which children can learn to read the clock. One player draws a tile and reads out the time printed on it. The other players have to be the first to adjust their large clocks to the time announced, so they can get the tile. The first player to get 12 tiles is the winner.

Name: Würfel-Roulette
Description: Roulette variant in which the results are determined by four dice. The maximum profit is 210 times the ante.
